channel.title: Which Computer?
channel.description:
Hey guys, So I've been trying to decide between a new computer to buy, as I have completely ruined the one I have at the moment, with junk downloads over the years. I've been wanting to get a new computer for a while now, and have come to the conclusion that I need to decide between two laptops.
[b]A Picture Of My Current Computer Because I Can't Find a Link:[/b] [IMG]http://i47.tinypic.com/25i2d5v.jpg[/img]
1. Samsung ChromeBook This is the link for the one I like the most at the moment [url=http://www.google.com/intl/en/chrome/devices/landing.html]http://www.google.com/intl/en/chrome/devices/landing.html[/url]
[code] Pros: -Cheaper -Free cloud storage -Lighter, more portable -Dual-Band Wifi, and 12 Flight Wifi passes
Cons: -Fairly new, hard to get a good helper with it -Every program runs off of the internet, if there is no internet, I would need 3rd party programs handy [/code]
2. Apple MacBook Pro This is the link for the MacBook I've been looking at [url=http://www.apple.com/macbook-pro/]http://www.apple.com/macbook-pro/[/url]
[code] Pros: -More stable -Less viruses (they claim)Well-known -Has a surplus of amazing reviews
Cons: -Horrendously Expensive -Running a private server will be different, from what I've heard -I will have to get used to a new OS [/code]
What I'm Looking For:
[ol][li]A Computer that doesn't overheat in a half hour of use[/li] [li]A Computer that can run RuneScape flawlessly[/li] [li]A Computer that can handle many Java projects[/li] [li]Good browser support[/li] [li]Everything that a computer should have[/li][/ol]
*Note: These aren't the only two computers I am open to look at. I am being very open-minded with this, and I am open to suggestions.

item.title: Which Computer?
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

If you want a computer to fit all of your interests stated above, I suggest purchasing a gaming computer online. You can probably find one starting off at around $700. They only problem with them is that most are probably desktops, which means you can’t move it all of the place as easily as a laptop allows.

Read full topic

item.title: Which Computer?
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Fills up hard drive with rubbish
Buys new computer

Just wipe the hard drive.

If you genuinely just want a new machine though, why are you asking us to compare a budget netbook with a high spec notebook? The choice is obvious.
And the ‘con’ point you have for the MacBook that states that you’d have to get used to a new OS is just silly, you’ll get that with both of your choices, it runs a Chrome OS not just a browser with ‘internet programs’.

Just buy a Windows laptop of similar price to the Macbook, you will not be disappointed, you can get a fairly high spec gaming notebook for that price.

Read full topic

item.title: Which Computer?
item.dc:creator: @gravenfire23 gravenfire23
item.description:
@gravenfire23 wrote:

[quote=“Owner-X, post:12, topic:470640”]Google Chrome is the most trustworthy browser in my opinion, and you can easily download other browsers off the internet. But let’s not get off topic.
Anyways, what do you guys think? I find the chromebook to be reliable, and I went out and tried it at a store yesterday. Very fast (this may just be because it’s brand new), and there is no problem connecting to the internet on it. Looks like it has very nice graphic handling, and download speed is very fast.[/quote]Don’t know much about chrome book but i would honestly stick with a windows PC, also you cant say the download speed is fast all that means is they have good internet at whatever store you were at.

Read full topic

item.title: Which Computer?
item.dc:creator: @someone2 someone2
item.description:
@someone2 wrote:

My point was that you cannot do much on a chromebook.

Read full topic

item.title: Which Computer?
item.dc:creator: @Owner-X Owner-X
item.description:
@Owner-X wrote:

Google Chrome is the most trustworthy browser in my opinion, and you can easily download other browsers off the internet. But let’s not get off topic.
Anyways, what do you guys think? I find the chromebook to be reliable, and I went out and tried it at a store yesterday. Very fast (this may just be because it’s brand new), and there is no problem connecting to the internet on it. Looks like it has very nice graphic handling, and download speed is very fast.

Read full topic

item.title: Which Computer?
item.dc:creator: @gravenfire23 gravenfire23
item.description:
@gravenfire23 wrote:

[quote=“someone2, post:9, topic:470640”]You know you can only use google chrome on that?[/quote]And this is a bad thing?

Read full topic

item.title: Which Computer?
item.dc:creator: @Owner-X Owner-X
item.description:
@Owner-X wrote:

The chromebook is around 250 dollars. And the Mac I won’t be buying, my dad has his that he doesn’t really want any more.

Read full topic

item.title: Which Computer?
item.dc:creator: @someone2 someone2
item.description:
@someone2 wrote:

Why would you buy a chromebook? You know you can only use google chrome on that? Also, chromebooks are around 500-600 + dollars. You can get way better for that.

Why would you go for an apple mac? If you can afford that you could afford a way way better PC, probably cheaper too. Also, you can barely do anything on a mac.

Read full topic

item.title: Which Computer?
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“gravenfire23, post:6, topic:470640”][quote author=eyeownyew link=topic=588121.msg4171353#msg4171353 date=1354394600]
Or you could build a computer… It’s a lot less complicated than it seems. For the $1700 you’d be willing to pay for a Macbook Pro, you could build a computer w/ windows with a 3.6GhZ processor and a GTX680/690, 4-64gb of ram, whatever else you want really. Could run anything flawlessly.
[/quote]I think he’s looking for a laptop, and building a laptop is a little more complicated then building a PC.[/quote]
Ah, I didn’t know if it mattered whether or not he was getting a PC or a laptop. Yeah, don’t try to build a laptop.

Read full topic

item.title: Which Computer?
item.dc:creator: @Owner-X Owner-X
item.description:
@Owner-X wrote:

Hey guys,
So I’ve been trying to decide between a new computer to buy, as I have completely ruined the one I have at the moment, with junk downloads over the years.
I’ve been wanting to get a new computer for a while now, and have come to the conclusion that I need to decide between two laptops.

A Picture Of My Current Computer Because I Can’t Find a Link:

  1. Samsung ChromeBook
    This is the link for the one I like the most at the moment http://www.google.com/intl/en/chrome/devices/landing.html 
Pros:
-Cheaper
-Free cloud storage
-Lighter, more portable
-Dual-Band Wifi, and 12 Flight Wifi passes

Cons:
-Fairly new, hard to get a good helper with it
-Every program runs off of the internet, if there is no internet, I would need 3rd party programs handy
  1. Apple MacBook Pro
    This is the link for the MacBook I’ve been looking at http://www.apple.com/macbook-pro/ 
Pros:
-More stable
-Less viruses (they claim)Well-known
-Has a surplus of amazing reviews

Cons:
-Horrendously Expensive
-Running a private server will be different, from what I've heard
-I will have to get used to a new OS

What I’m Looking For:

[ol][li]A Computer that doesn’t overheat in a half hour of use[/li]
[li]A Computer that can run RuneScape flawlessly[/li]
[li]A Computer that can handle many Java projects[/li]
[li]Good browser support[/li]
[li]Everything that a computer should have[/li][/ol]

*Note: These aren’t the only two computers I am open to look at. I am being very open-minded with this, and I am open to suggestions.

Read full topic
